intro: Valeriana pennellii, commonly known as the pink valerian, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Valeriana pennellii is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used for its calming effects.
